intro: Gilia lottiae, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Gilia lottiae is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
